title: When does FL 160 have to be filed?
question: we have a MSA. is FL 160 still necessary?
question_tags: Divorce,Dividing debts in a divorce,Divorce by default judgment,Divorce and bankruptcy,Bankruptcy,Debt,Bankruptcy and debt,Lawsuits and disputes,Marital property,Default judgment
answers: If it was not filed with the original petition, you should make sure that it is attached with your Marital Settlement Agreement (MSA). Best of luck.

Accord with Mr. Williams' response. A FL-160 has to be filed in connection with a default judgment so that the Court can evaluate the property and debt issues in coming to a decision. In your situation, it won't be needed.

It is NOT part of the mandatory declarations of disclosure. Some local rules of Court require it. If you have a mandatory settlement conference, then you ARE required to do a Mandatory Settlement Conference brief. While personally I think that the schedule of assets and debts and the property declaration are very similar, I have NEVER not had a client do a property declaration from the beginning and it would be a good idea to attach it to your settlement conference brief as there are obvious disagreements and it can only help the process.

If it was not filed with the original petition, you should make sure that it is attached with your Marital Settlement Agreement (MSA). Best of luck.
